document_title: What is dense breast tissue? Causes, diagnosis, significance and risks
subsection_name: mo-vu-day-dac.json_1_How does dense breast tissue affect density?
subsection_content:
There is an increased chance that breast cancer may go undetected with a mammogram, as dense breast tissue can hide underlying cancer.
1. Dense breast tissue makes it difficult to see cancer on mammograms
Dense breast tissue (fibrous and glandular) appears white on a mammogram. Tumors and cancers are also white. So, dense tissues can make them more difficult to see. In contrast, fatty tissue looks almost black on a mammogram, so it's easier to see a white lump if most of the breast is fatty tissue. [first]
2. Women with dense breast tissue have a higher risk of breast cancer
It is still unclear why breast tissue thickening is associated with breast cancer risk. It may be because dense breast tissue has more cells, which develop into abnormal cells. [2]
Dense breast tissue appears white on a mammogram.
